page.title: 12Churches
page.content: Christ Church was built in 1789 by Act of Parliament for the Misses Alsager, co-heiresses of the Manor. Constructed of Portland stone in Palladian classic style, it has a fine clock tower and eight bells. St. Mary's Church was completed in 1898. Built in the decorated Gothic style of brown Alton stone, it has a chancel with a fine east window, a nave of five bays, aisles, organ chamber, two porches and several beautiful stained glass windows. Hassall Road Methodist Chapel built in 1834, and opened by the Rev. Charles Janion where later a Sunday School was opened for all denominations. St. Lukes, Oakhanger, was dedicated in 1930 and under the patronage of the vicar of Christ Church, was a school until 1911, built on land donated by the Doddingtons.
